intro: Fernandezia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Fernandezia weberbaueri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
